headline: On-the-go coronavirus test maker gets $10 million NIH contract to scale up production
summary: "The intent is really to be able to decentralize PCR testing and make it available to anyone who needs to get tested," medical device maker Visby CEO Adam de La Zerda told CNBC's Jim Cramer.

headline: Cramer's week ahead: Too much complacency about a stimulus deal

summary: Cal/OSHA said Amazon failed to provide adequate health and safety training at two warehouses.
headline: Amazon fined by OSHA for coronavirus safety violations at two California warehouses

summary: Not only will 5G utterly transform our ability to work across geographies, but it will revolutionize productivity at the work site. Whether it’s giving field technicians, construction teams, and others real-time data and the ability to share timely insights almost instantly, enabling workers to address new challenges in real time with augmented reality-driven guidance, or employing autonomous vehicles and robots to improve worker safety, 5G will fuel exponential technologies.
The pandemic continues to benefit device makers, with people leaning harder on PCs for both business and personal reasons.
headline: The PC market is the hottest it's been in a decade, says Canalys

summary: The White House likely just upped its stimulus package offer. Here's what that means for the proposed second round of stimulus checks.

summary: To make your money last, experts recommend taking out around 4% of your nest egg per year in retirement. Here's how much spending money you'll have if you retire with $3 million.

With $3 billion on the line, expect NFL games to continue despite Covid-19 outbreak
summary: The NFL continues to see increased Covid-19 positive cases among players and staff forcing the league to tighten its protocols, issuing fines to players and staff.

headline: HSBC calls start of a 'great rebalancing' as the global economy enters a flatter stage of the recovery
summary: A "great rebalancing" of investor portfolios away from core government bonds and a "coupon clipping environment" for markets are coming, according to HSBC Global Asset Management.

headline: Broadway to remain closed through May 30
summary: The Broadway League, a trade organization representing producers and theater owners, announced Friday that Broadway's 41 theaters will remain closed through at least May 30.
